title.narrative: FLC: Haki Africa Trust - Building resilience of women against violent extremism

description.narrative: HAKI Africa is a community human rights organisation based in Mombasa working to improve livelihoods and enhance the progressive realisation of human rights in Kenya. Initiated in 2012 the organisation promotes partnership between state and non-state actor s in order to constantly improve the well-being of individuals and communities and ensure respect for human rights and rule of law by all. Particularly the organization seeks to agitate for the recognition and empowerment of local communities in Kenya to f ully participate in rights and development initiatives with a view to improving the standards of living amongst all including the poor and marginalized.Insecurity at the Coast of Kenya has been on steady increase over the last few years with the situation worsening from late 2013 onwards. Since the move to pursue Al Shabaab into Somalia Kenya has not only seen a drastic increase of terror attacks in the form of grenades and improvised explosive devises but also serious international terrorism.The main objec tives of the proposed project: -To empower women on how to counter violent extremism in order to build their resilience to radicalization;-To initiate effective dialogue between women in state and non-state agencies with a particular emphasis on female pol ice female youth and women in civil society;-To work with female youth from hotspot areas to address issues of human rights and security as an entry point to addressing extremism and radicalization amongst their peers; and-To forge closer working relations between female police civil society actors and community women through undertaking joint activities at the grassrootsProject Outcomes:-A pool of resource persons trained on gender human rights and security available and at the disposal of the community;-W omen taking their rightful position in leading and participating in discussions on human rights and security at the community level;-Communities adopting and implementing gender sensitive strategies to promoting human rights and security;-Women?s resilienc e against violent extremism strengthened;-Strengthened networking and good working relations between women and security authorities;-Religious leaders made aware of the need to engage with women and adopt positions that are sensitive to both genders;
